definition: to piece together/to join together/to stake all/adventurous/at the risk of one's life/to spell

sentences.english: Alexander thinks Artest is the missing piece to a championship-caliber team.
sentences.chinese: 亞歷山大認爲，阿泰斯特就是總冠軍那塊拼版。

sentences.english: Joint Printing, mainly engaged in printing business make-up.
sentences.chinese: 聯合印務，主要經營拼版印刷業務。

sentences.english: Pagination the numbering of the make-up pages in consecutive order of a book.
sentences.chinese: 在拼版後的書頁加上順序頁碼的情況。

sentences.english: Electronic composition computer-assisted typeset ting and page make up.
sentences.chinese: 電子排版用電腦輔助的排字和拼版。

sentences.english: The page proofs have been read and approved by the responsible reader .
sentences.chinese: 拼版樣已經審稿人審讀通過。

sentences.english: "The pieces coming together is just a beginning component of the campaign, " he said.
sentences.chinese: “拼版只是整個活動的開始，”他說。

definition: to edge-join boards with glue to form a panel (woodworking)
color printing/abbr. for 彩色印刷[cai3 se4 yin4 shua1]
diagram/picture/drawing/chart/map/CL:張|张[zhang1]/to plan/to scheme/to attempt/to pursue/to seek
